body: Which is correct since `<a href="b\"c"` is invalid.
I don’t understand what you mean by that.
``` html a a ``` which gives us ``` js document.querySelector('a').attributes[1] == 'htm"'; ``` you can't escape quotes in html
we can't assume that you want HTML-encoded stuff in your attribute

Whyever not? Particularly when the alternative is a mangled attribute that ought to be an accurate representation of an entire object, seeing as JSON-encoding is a special case for data attributes.

The representation of the attribute’s value in HTML should _not_ change the behaviour of any script interacting with the document. I’ve heard that Angular JS has some problems with this, but the fault lies there. (And once again — half an object isn’t better.)

There is a good solution:
1. Escape apostrophes, because the current behaviour is quite wrong
2. If things break, that’s a bug too

how is "assuming people want html here" a good solution?
that may be better than just breaking but there's no workaround

How is “assuming people don’t want HTML here” a good problem? When would this make a difference? It certainly doesn’t when reading them: ``` javascript var d = document.createElement('div'); d.innerHTML = ''; d.children[0].dataset.example // ' ``` Jade handles double-quotes in the same manner: ``` echo "a(href='\"')" | jade ``` ``` html ```
if it has this behavior already then yes, let's follow it
The non-data attribute behavior is slightly different, but yes, in principle, we could do better here by carefully choosing better things to escape.

issue.title: Roadmap

repository.name: pug
repository.description: Pug – robust, elegant, feature rich template engine for Node.js

issue.body:
This document outlines what features can be expected to change before jade gets to 1.0.0 (i.e. stability).
## For discussion
- [ ] Serialization of data-attributes, should it really do `JSON.stringify` (#1062 #1075)
- [ ] Consider defaults for debug mode (#1098)
## Tasks for post 1.0.0
- [ ] Update documentation
- [ ] Build bot to fix code reliant on deprecated features
- [ ] Add auto-completion plugin for brackets.io
## Future
- [ ] Child templates with contents should throw an error (#870)
- [ ] Better errors for incorrectly named blocks in extending templates (#885)
- [ ] Provide API for exposing dependency graph of jade files for dynamic recompilation (#957)
- [ ] Error when the same block appears multiple times in a file (#1009)
- [ ] Runtime filters so that interpolation is an option, this is up for debate (#1146)
